questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The exhibit shows the SD-WAN rule status and configuration.
Based on the exhibit, which change in the measured latency will make T_MPLS_0 the new preferred member?

choices.D: When T_N1PLS_0 has a latency of 80 ms.
choices.A: When T_INET_0_0 and T_MPLS_0 have the same latency.
choices.C: When T_INET_0_0 has a latency of 250 ms.
choices.B: When T_MPLS_0 has a latency of 100 ms.
Application control must be enabled on the firewall policy.
choices.C: Web filtering must be enabled on the firewall policy.
choices.A: Destination internet service must be enabled on the traffic shaping policy.
choices.D: Individual SD-WAN members must be selected as the outgoing interface on the traffic shaping policy.

//IMG//


Exhibit B -
//IMG//

Exhibit A shows the traffic shaping policy and exhibit B shows the firewall policy.
The administrator wants FortiGate to limit the bandwidth used by YouTube. When testing, the administrator determines that FortiGate does not apply traffic shaping on YouTube traffic.
Based on the policies shown in the exhibits, what configuration change must be made so FortiGate performs traffic shaping on YouTube traffic?

questions.question_text: Which are three key routing principles in SD-WAN? (Choose three.)

choices.D: By default, SD-WAN members are skipped if they do not have a valid route to the destination.
choices.C: SD-WAN rules have precedence over ISDB routes.
choices.E: By default, SD-WAN rules are skipped if the best route to the destination is not an SD-WAN member.
choices.B: Regular policy routes have precedence over SD-WAN rules.
choices.A: FortiGate performs route lookups for new sessions only.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
B,D,E are correct
Study Guide 7.0, such as below.
Study Guide 7.2, pages 125, 129, 151
B, D, E are correct
B, D, E is correct

Selected Answer: BDE
Sorry, page 104

Selected Answer: BDE
B - Correct - Regular policy routes have precedence over SD-WAN rules.
D - Correct - A a valid route must be in the route table (tested in my lab)
E - Correct - if a better route exist in the route table the SD-WAN rule will be skipped (tested in my lab)
A - Incorrect - route lookup are after route changes
C - Incorrect - ISDB routes become policy routes, which take precedence over SD-WAN rules

Selected Answer: BDE
study guide page 125

BDE correct

comments.content: I agree with you! There is no explicatin on Study Guide for letter "A" be correct, so the correct is "B, C, D".

C is incorrect, 7.0 study guide p.108
ISDB route with precedence to SDWAN rule

discussion.content:
Answer B, C, D 
Page 104 Study Guide 
A - should not be correct. 
FortiGate Performs route look up for both original and reply traffic. 
Dirty session re-evaluated that also take route-lookup. 

B - Correct - Regular policy routes have precedence over SD-WAN rules. 
C and D - Correct 
By default, SD-WAN rules are skipped if:
 - Best route to destination isn't an SD-WAN member 
 - None of the members have a valid route to destination
A,D are correct

Selected Answer: AD
B is wrong, Policy route over SDWAN
C is wrong, implicit rule with ID=0

Selected Answer: AD
A,D are correct
A , D is correct

choices.B: The SD-WAN rules take precedence over regular policy routes.
choices.A: There is more than one SD-WAN rule configured.
choices.C: The all_rules rule represents the implicit SD-WAN rule.
choices.D: Entry 1(id=1) is a regular policy route.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about SLA targets and SD-WAN rules are true? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Member metrics are measured only if an SLA target is configured.
choices.A: When configuring an SD-WAN rule, you can select multiple SLA targets of the same performance SLA.
choices.B: SD-WAN rules use SLA targets to check if the preferred members meet the SLA requirements.
choices.C: SLA targets are used only by SD-WAN rules that are configured with Lowest Cost (SLA) or Maximize Bandwidth (SLA) as strategy.

discussion.content:
BC 
D , best quality , measures it without SLA target , A is incorrect

Selected Answer: BC
B,C is correct, D is incorrect because you can measure metrics for Best Quality without SLA targets. C is correct becuase those are the only strategies that require SLA targets
